intro: Prangos goniocarpa, commonly known as the Kashmir spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, preferring rocky and arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, with a prominent cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
